catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 389
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: men with horses in scene framed by willow trees, with calm shoreline at L and R sides, small pavilion covered with vines, and high-walled building; inscription panel at far R
inscription: front panel: (Preface by Asai Tonan [1709-1793]) | Dated: Kansei 5 [1793], painted in the spirit of the Ming artist Chu Ying, signed: Gen Okyo; end of scroll: [(I) copied a work by the Ming dynasty\'s Kyuei in the spring, the first month of 1793. Minamoto Okyo]
markings: Seals URQ and LLC of preface; seals L edge of image: Okyo no in | Chusen
medium: Ink and light color on silk
title: Horseback Riding at West Lake
